snippet: Despite weighing as much as 300 pounds, the objects are apparently valued as scrap metal and have been disappearing at alarming rates, according to officials.
abstract: Consolidated Edison officials say that theft of manhole covers in New York City is on the rise; more than 30 of the heavy covers have gone missing from the streets of Queens, Brooklyn and the Bronx since March; covers are assumed to have value as scrap metal.
lead_paragraph: Despite weighing as much as 300 pounds, the objects are apparently valued as scrap metal and have been disappearing at alarming rates, according to officials.

headline.main: Manhole Lid Theft Is On the Rise
headline.print_headline: The World of Street Crime Has an Increasingly Popular Target: Manhole Covers
